intro: Hieracium creperiforme, commonly known as the crepe-shaped hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive, flattened shape. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from June to August, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
